SEARCH
Module com.example.clientscheduler
Package com.example.clientscheduler

Class modApptController

java.lang.Object
com.example.clientscheduler.modApptController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class modApptController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Pre-loads and allows for modification of Client Appointments. This class pulls the selected appointment's info from the database and pre-populates the fields so that only necessary modifications need to be entered. Like the Appointment Addition controller, this too, plans for input validation.

  • Method Details

    • setApptID

      public void setApptID(Object ID) throws SQLException
      This method grabs all database information pertaining to the selected appointment, particularly the ID, and calls the setApptItems method to populate.
      Parameters:
      ID - The passed-in Appointment ID number collected from the database upon window initialization.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onApptSave

      public void onApptSave() throws Exception
      This method gathers any modifications to the selected appointment and uploads them to the database. Before it does that, it makes sure to convert all times to UTC and validates any input so that all fields are correctly populated including overlapping appointments, empty fields, and appointments within business hours.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • onApptCancel

      public void onApptCancel()
      Closes out of the Appointment Modification form and reloads the main Client Scheduling window.

    • setApptItems

      public void setApptItems(ArrayList<String> items) throws SQLException
      Main method that acquires items from the setApptID method and populates the form with existing database info. For ID handling, it grabs the associated IDs from the database and utilizes switch statements to verify which ID belongs to which person.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of items correlating to the appointment from the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the form including both the contact and customer ComboBoxes and sets the ID to the maximum per the database MAX.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Standard Parameter
      resourceBundle - Standard Parameter
